Edward Nashton, also known as The Riddler, is a character portrayed by actor Paul Dano in The Batman shared universe media franchise, based on the DC Comics character of the same name created by Bill Finger and Bob Kane, and portrayed by actor Paul Dano.

Reception
John Nugent, writing for Empire, praised Paul Dano's performance as "chilling" and described the character as a "bespectacled terrorist of the Trump era, driven by an incelâ€™s misplaced sense of injustice and a love of fiendish puzzles. (And latte foam art.)" Writing in The Atlantic, David Sims also praised Dano's performance, describing it as "appreciably squirmy and unpredictable, switching from singsong nerdiness to guttural rage in an instant".
